name: nevada-basic-data-for-thermal-springs-and-wells-as-recorded-in-geotherm-part-a-u-s-geological-s
notes: INTRODUCTIONnGEOTHERM, a computerized information system now off-line, wasnused to maintain data on the geology, geochemistry and hydrologynof geothermal sites primarily within the United States. Thensystem was proposed a t the First Geothermal Implementation Conferencenin New Zealand in 1974 and was active until 1983. The primary mission was to provide a broad informational framework for the Geothermal Research Program. GEOTHERM was used to support national geothermal assessments.  It was however a public system and provided data to both public and private sectors. A detailed discussion on databases in GEOTHERM and a general scheme of how the information system operated can be found in Bliss and Rapport (1983).nnThis report on Nevada is one of a series intended to preserve the data collected for GEOTHERM and make the data available to the public. This report will give summaries and sources of records for Nevada. The complete records for Nevada can be found in a companion report, US. Geological Survey Open-File Report 83-433B, which is issured as MICROFICHE ONLY. States with significant geochemical data for geothermal fluids will be coverednin individual reports such as this. A report will also be issuednto cover miscellaneous data collected for sites in the centralnand eastern United States.
